observationText: Loss of dNf1 in Drosophila results in approximately 25% reduction in pupal weight compared to controls.
The reduced growth rate in dNf1 Drosophila mutants is not due to altered feeding behavior, developmental timing, or insulin-like peptide expression.
Overexpression of the insulin-like peptide Ilp2 in dNf1 larvae results in a similar increase in size as in wild-type flies, suggesting the growth defect is not due to impaired insulin signaling.
Loss of dNf1 does not affect adult longevity in Drosophila compared to wild-type controls.
